page.title: 07HOME LIFE
page.content:
LOOKING BACK 50 YEARS IN FULMER
She remembered 50 years ago warming herself at the blacksmith's fire on the way home from school.The homes had neither running water or electricity. Oil lamps were used for lighting and the water was carried from the village pump. Milk was collected twice a day from the village farm and the bread was baked in the village bakery.Quite a lot of sweets could be bought for a farthing. This is the equivalent of a tenth of a new pence. To-day a bar of chocolate costs 18p. The road wasn't even made up and there was no bus service they had to walk. There was an old couple with a donkey and cart who gathered herbs and blackberries to sell in Gerrards Cross. Times have changed.
